She brought us appetizers and took our order.  One hour and forty minutes later, the minor at our table was threatening to eat the napkins, and my other dining companion was ready to walk out.  Over an hour and half wait for the main course is ridiculous, but what makes it even worse was the fact that our waitress didn't stop by even once to tell us what the hell was going on.    Things became even more ludicrous when we realized that several people had come, sat down, ordered, eaten, and left in that 1 hour and 40 minutes, and we still hadn't even seen our food yet.      One hour and 45 minutes later our food arrived, and our waitress said she was sorry it took so long, that it was crazy in the kitchen because of the party of 35, and that's all we got.  We waited all that time, didn't get refills, no extra apps to hold us over, no discount on the bill, nothing.  We ate in 15 minutes and then we were done.    It was the the most outrageous, unprofessional behavior we have ever encountered in a dining establishment. They might as well have told us to "get the F out" when we walked in the door, it would have been less insulting.

I came here because I didnt know where else to get rendang beef. Unfortunately, this was the worst rendang beef ive ever had. It was more dry and less flavorful than what im used to. That being said, every other rendang beef ive ever had was nothing short of incredible, so this was still a fairly tasty dish to eat for dinner.  Although I was disappointed with my order, I find myself tempted to come back and try ordering something else. The atmosphere is cool and the service is friendly and accomodating. Plus, they do a lot of deals and specials. I feel that I wouldve given them 4 stars had I ordered something better.  Pros: friendly staff, lots of deals and specials Cons: disappointing rendang beef

I'm never disappointed with the food. Flavorful and healthy. They make homemade tempeh and it's very tasty. I asked them to switch out the egg plant and green peppers in my dish and the substituted other yummy veggies. Plus there was classical guitar musicians playing.

Simply put, if you're eating ethnic food out in Madison, this is the place to be. Otek Otek is fantastic appetizer. These steamed smoked fish in banana leaf with sweet nut sauce are light and tasty. Opor Ayam, a chicken curry in coconut sauce, was incredible!! Pulled chicken and potatoes are transformed by the sauce into something sublime. Sambal borek papaya is also a stunning dish, and complements the Opor Ayam nicely. Green papaya is cooked to perfection and accompanying sauce is tasty and doesn't overpower the flavor of papaya. We shared dishes and the server was nice to bring out extra plates. It amounted to a great time. We'll be back!

Well I just order online yesterday for dinner the food taste was awful, I order martabak was burn, rendang taste blend whatsoever sate kambing and ayam taste blend also includes Tempe sorry I don't want prefer anymore

yyyyyeah, i'm gonna need more stars.  (i think i maybe delayed writing this review because i subconsciously enjoy this place being a hidden little secret.....then i realized, that's not very yelp of me!)  the food here is so good it actually feels like i'm being transported TO indonesia.  or at least what i imagine it would be like there.....flavor heaven!  first off, being vegan/vegetarian does not limit you much on this menu - that's fun, and rare.  house-made tempeh and amazingly creative combinations makes everything i've had here pop.  aaaand, the staff is very willing, able, happy and a bit intuitive in helping you decide - even making up things not on the menu!  very fun.  and then add the delightful company of corey d. into the mix..... yyyyyyyeah, i'm gonna need more stars.  *and at dinner they have this cool thing that's a super sampler of small sized entrees that you choose, i want to say the name is actually dutch for 'rice table', anyway, i highly recommend that for your first time.  great way to get a broad brush experience of the place and find out what you like.  that's what i did, and it hooked me.

Easily the best food I had in Madison. Vegan Indo mac & cheese, mango curry, vegan thai iced tea, "Motor Oil" cocktail (Old Rasputin stout, Jameson, espresso liqueur in a pint glass). Quick, attentive service, and pleasant eclectic atmosphere. I want to try at least 10 more of Bandung's imaginative cocktails. If this had been the first place I went to on my trip, I might've never tried another restaurant.

Dairy-free mac and cheese?! In, done, delicious.  I came here for an IYE with my fellow yelpers on Trivia night. Appetizers were delicious, especially the spicy chicken wings. I could eat those all day. The star of the meal was definitely the indo mac and cheese. This plate was spicy, creamy goodness without a hint of dairy. I've contemplated coming back every day for this treat. However, I'd probably only come back on any other night besides trivia night. I thought our food came out a little later than I had hoped, but I saw some tables receive their dishes after nearly an hour. Yikes!  Overall, amazing food, great appetizers. I look forward to coming back on a night with faster service. But I will most definitely be back.
Did not make me want to go to Indonesia. Sorry this is so brief but there was nothing extraordinary about any part of our meal. Service was so so. Probably will not return. Very pricey.

I look forward to eating at Bandung every time I am in Madison. Usually once per year. The Vegetable Curry with bamboo chutes is so fricken good, you'll lose your mind! The bamboo is so tender, you'll think they're noodles! From the sound of the other reviewers, I seem to get lucky with the service. They've been friendly enough to me. Or perhaps I go at the right time, because I don't seem to to recall it ever being too terribly busy. The prices seemed fair and decent to me too. I don't blame folks for docking stars for bad or nasty service, but for those reviewers who don't seem to care for tasty international flavors nor the price of a $7.95 lunch or a $9.95 dinner...may I suggest Swanson® Frozen Foods.

We go here a lot for lunch work events. It's a fantastic restaurant that is interesting and delicious and we all seem to enjoy it. They don't really give a hard time about the check deal where you have to work out who owes what. They're usually pretty polite and the food is delicious!
Pad Thai = 5 boom towns. It's just that good. Also, decent beer selection!

Ordered the Indo Mac n Cheese w/ Chicken and was not disappointed. I love this place. I've only ordered delivery, but I will soon be making a personal visit. The rest of their menu is calling my name.

My husband and I went to Madison when we crossed Illinois to go to South Dakota but now I think we went to Madison for this restaurant. I am Indonesian and since I got to US my husband and I are kinda in a mission trying all Indonesian restaurant. We found this restaurant accidentally from their website. We were quite impressed by their website and it makes our expectation quite high too. When we got to the plaza where this restaurant is placed, we were just ok. When we stepped in and greeted by their staff, we felt so welcome. We didn't wait too long for the usher and our server was incredibly nice. Bandung restaurant has great ambience, neat, clean and it really brings Indonesian uniqueness by displaying some of Indonesia crafts. After we were seated they gave us water and tempe crackers, nice!! Now the food, we ordered spring rolls and martabak telor as appetizer and we both satisfied with them. They served it fast and hot and tasty. Myhusband order small shrimp sizzling. He likes if, for his American tastebud who like spicy in food he said it wasn't that spicy and for my Indonesian tastebud it is good, it tastes like the food that I ate in Indonesia. I ordered Ikan rica rica which is fish, mahi mahi in chilly garlicy sauce which is sooo nice and good. We both ordered small portion which is really small. My husband shrimps dish had 4 pieces of shrimps and mine had 2 small pieces fish. If you are hungry please don't order small portion but if you are not sure with Indonesian food, small portion is perfect. Really, if you are all interested in trying Indonesian food and around Madison area, this restaurant is highly recommended, it is really like what we have back in Indonesia. My husband and I definitely will be back for another dish.

Really great food, can't wait to return. Went here for a date night. Great service, started with Sayur Lodeh (great soup) and finished with Pad Thai. My date had the special and we shared our meals. We will be back!!

I would be willing to try Bandung again but I would say my first experience was disappointing.   I had checked out their menu online and was debating between getting delivery or just picking it up myself. I decided to pick it up myself because there was a note that said it would take up to 45 mins. I called and placed my order and was told it would be about 20-25 mins.  I got there on time and I had to wait an additional 20 mins. I'm a patient person but if that was the case I would have gotten delivery. Also if you place your order online the prices reflect if you opt for delivery not if you pick it up (prices are higher), just an FYI. I was not given a total before hanging up so so I ended up paying more than I would have liked.   The indo mac I would say had a great flavor to it. But I was hoping for a lot more chicken and veggies and felt like it was 75% just noodles. The lumpia was neither good or bad just average I would say.  They do trivia on Monday nights if you are looking for a place to go!

I was very impressed with Bandung. The first item I tried was the mango curry. It was delicious. My most recent order was pad thai with tofu and their version of egg rolls for delivery. The food arrived within 20 minutes on a Saturday evening. There are few places that can deliver that quickly, especially on a Saturday evening.   The food was hot, fresh, and delicious! The portions were huge and lasted me 2-3 meals. I highly recommend them and will definitely be ordering again!

My husband and I went here for a date night. I thought the prices were pretty fair, and the service was good. We started out with beverages (I had the ginger martini, it was amazing, he had a beer).  We're both vegetarians and were impressed with the amount of vegetarian/vegan offerings on the menu.  We started with a sautéed tofu appetizer, which was pretty good. I loved the dipping sauce.  Our food came out in decent time. I had the red curry squash with tofu, as I had read it was good, and it didn't disappoint. It was really delicious, and I'd definitely get it again.  My husband went with the sate tempe, because we were curious about the house made tempeh. I think it would have been perfect as an appetizer, but it was just way too much as a main course. If you REALLY love tempeh this would be perfect. As it turns out, we weren't such big fans of that one, but the peanut sauce was excellent.  We did end up ordering desert, which I assume wasn't house made (some sort of caramel cheesecake), and it was decent.  All in all, we would for sure go back.

I love asian food. I've been to most of the asian restruants in Madison, and I have to say, this has go to be the best one in town. Pad thai, I know, is kind of cliche, but man I think Bandung has perfected it. They have many other unique and wonderful indonesian meals also, some come sizzling to your table! They are very vegetarian friendly. They also accept Bitcoin!

Second time here with fellow employees. Great atmosphere and food. I recommend ordering the Rijstaffel. It is Dutch for "rice table". Make sure you have a group of 5 or more so you don't get charged a sharing fee.

Oh gosh, I don't even know what day my boyfriend and I went in, but it was definitely a lunch day sometime before this past Christmas and I will just say that when a place boasts about having the best Pad Thai in town that they better have the best Pad Thai in town. And they do! On top of it our server, a younger lady with brown hair, was incredibly professional and super natural and nice. Good service is always a win. We were the only two in and we were attended, but not over looked after. We also god shrimp with sweet tomato sauce and rice. I can't remember the name of the dish, but it was very good. Moderately priced and good atmosphere.
Cool place to eat. Awesome cocktails as well as food. I love the coconut cocktail and the Ikan Rica Rica. They just opened a bar.

Cheap eats Sunday through Thursday in the bar area. Select dishes (pad thai, Indo mac & cheese, something that was vegetarian that I don't remember the name of, and fried rice) for $5. Portions are more than sufficient for one person and are tasty (try the Indo Mac & Cheese. It's really just noodles with a red curry sauce, bamboo shoots, and your choice of protein). Thursday night at 9pm there is adult trivia (X-rated!) in the bar area (aka The Nutty Bar) so be warned. The bartender makes a good Mai Tai.

I was expecting an authentic indonesian restaurant in madison. reason is that there are many indonesian student in Madison. but apparently, not. don't get me wrong, it is not bad, because the food is now tailored to american taste. I'm kinda surprise to see soo many people in the restaurant, and I'm the only non white. I ordered empek2, sayur lodeh, tahu and some other items. the food don't even look right (close), but it don't taste even close to what it supposed to be. if you think you've taste indonesian food and you think that place taste good. wait till you taste the real good one. it will blow your sock off.  good place to get to know indonesian food. but for people who are looking for good indonesian food, not here.
Great food.  Take a long time to get it..... And why no one offer desert at the end? You can make more money...

Delicious food!! Tons of great options for vegetarians and omnivores alike. I recommend the Rujak Cuka, vegetable curry (the seasoning was unlike any other, I loved it), and the tempeh. I ordered delivery and received exactly what I requested!

I'll be honest, I've eaten here off and on for the past 6-7 years and have ordered the same two dishes every time.  We peruse the menu, say 'oh, that sounds good' and then proceed to order the pad thai with only vegetables (no meat, no tempeh) and the ikan rica rica (mahi-mahi with a sauce so flavorful it puts us in a trance).  Both are, obviously, are delicious (hence the years-long trend) and consistently good.  The service is perfect, and the ambiance is warm and welcoming.  They've added a bar with live music and craft cocktails.  My husband and I did not partake in either, but I spotted some patrons on the dance floor which was a delight.  We've tried the lumpia (egg rolls) a few times as well.  The sauce that accompanies them is fantastic, but the rolls are forgettable and the little chips on the side are crumbly - my only criticism!
Very accessible from madison downtown for lunch. There is a lunch portin and you get lumpia with it. You will never get bored with the tempe.

I've eaten at Bandung many times, both in the restaurant and via delivery. It's always very tasty and fast! However, I just had a pretty terrifying realization -- this restaurant does not take allergies very seriously.  I have an egg allergy and I've made that explicitly clear every time I've eaten at the restaurant. This evening, after ordering, I got a phone call informing me that they have *always* marinated their meats in egg. How this hasn't made me sick in the past is beyond me, but hopefully this can serve as a warning to all you fellow allergy sufferers out there: Bandung may not take your allergies seriously and may serve you food that contains the allergens you've warned them about.   If you have any serious food allergies, I'd recommend avoiding this place entirely.

Extra star for the incredible service! The hostess was so so attentive, it was like being invited into someone home. I am really impressed!  The food was very tasty! I went with the vegetable curry, and it was mild, sweet, and well balanced. The portions are pretty decent for one person, but if I went again, I would want to try more dishes, family style.

My new favorite!  My boyfriend and I checked it out after being wowed by their award winning beef dish at Taste of Madison and we're so glad we did. The menu makes me feel like a fool because I can't pronounce anything on it but the servers are kind about correcting and helping you learn. It hardly matters anyway - as far as I can tell everything on it is delicious!   Go here if:  You love tempeh, in which case, prepare to have your expectations exceeded.   You want to grab dinner after 9pm - a constant struggle for the boyfriend and I with late work hours, so thanks Bandung!   You'd like to eat outside - it's cozy and there always seems to be open space.   What's with you Madison, how is Bandung such a quiet, well-kept secret? They have a good beer selection and solid pairing suggestions on their menu. Honestly - is there anything Bandung hasn't got going for themselves?
My wife and I both had the Pad Thai - incredible! Best Indonesian food I've ever eaten. Food was fresh and light, but filling. Will definitely be back and will tell our friends. Well done.

I can't resist their food, especially the gulai kamping, it the best food considered as a piece of art, delicious, traditional, and well prepared.. You can make it spicy if you enjoy spicy food as I am.. I honestly order it with extra extra extra spicy.. Everything they offer is good spicy or not.. Is it so far my favorite restaurant here in Madison..

I came here for lunch and it was relatively empty, but I was at the tail-end of the lunch hour.  I ordered the pad-thai and my sister ordered the indo-mac. We ordered tempeh chips as appetizers. The chips were interesting, but in the end tasted like fried chips - similar to potato.   I thought the Pad Thai was good, but not the best I've ever had. It was very sweet compared to most other pad thais. The heat level left a bit to be desired and they don't give you the choice to order spicier.  The bite I had of the indomac was good. It has a very weird mouth feel - very creamy. This dish was also extremely sweet - sweeter than the pad thai.  I'd be very interested in coming back to try a curry.

I ate here a long time ago but was impressed by the peanut curry I had and the friendly service. The waiter was knowledgeable about what was vegan or what could be made vegan.  The atmosphere is pretty nice here, too and the restaurant could serve as a good date spot.

A lovely restaurant with tasty food! I've been here a few times as a couple and in a lunch group and always enjoyed the food.  I wowed my friends by setting a birthday lunch here and they even let me bring in my own cake.  Everything on the menu I've tried so far has been good but my favorites are the crispy cat fish dishes, all three are wonderful.  The lunch special is a good deal - a choice of appetizer and entree for about $10. We tried the egg rolls and cream cheese fried wontons and the wontons were a big hit. I only have a few downsides that lost this place a star.  First, they have terrible parking that's always full because of the nearby restaurants.  We had issues all getting spots and almost gave up and left. Second,  they only had one high chair for kids. I guess it's not a family oriented restaurant but we had two toddlers in our group and couldn't seat them both in high chairs. Last, the lighting needs to be a little brighter. I can understand a dim light for romantic dinners but at lunchtime it was way too dark. Other than those complaints I love this place and will go again and again. Plus, their lamb is halal!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Madison. The first time was for a rehearsal dinner back in 2003. It is located in a small strip mall and the outside looks pretty average. Inside, it is pretty with lots of Indonesian art on the walls and dim lighting. The food is the real show stopper though; I especially love the rendang curry. The seafood and produce always taste really fresh. They are clearly all about quality products and bold flavors here. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in Madison!

Nice variety of Indonesian dishes (several vegetarian, with tempeh!) and drinks, creatively presented. Food was tasty, well presented. I had the mango curry with tempeh, a small portion size which was just right. It was all so delicious we forgot to take pictures before gobbling it down.   Can't believe I haven't visited this place for as long as I've lived in Madison. Will be back.

Bandung's food exceeds expectations.  Although it was slow for the waitress (who turned out to be the helpful and cheery manager) to get to us at the start, everything else came in a timely fashion.  The spring rolls are amazing, we had to order seconds which swiftly came out.  The chicken pad thai claims "best in town" and I couldn't agree more.  Definitely check this place out!

Good food and service. Been there multiple times. Tried the red Thai curry and the yellow curry rice which tasted amazing. Nice music too !  Went again and this times favorite - Mango curry with tofu :)

I hadn't been here in years and was happy it hasn't lost quality. Our party of four had the Pangsit Goreng as an appetizer. It was good. I wouldn't necessarily run there to get it again, but it was fine. Beer list was good for an Indonesian restaurant. Local and regional micros were available. The entrees and service really shined. We had: Indo Mac, Pad Thai, Sambal Goreng Udang and Holy Basil Stir Fry. Everyone was very happy with their entrees. The Indo Mac was near PERFECT. Great flavors and perfect heat level for me (could've been spicier, but I would've enjoyed it less. I had a wonderful heat left in my mouth).  Serving sizes were spot on for dinner. I can't wait to go back and have the Indo Mac again.

We got takeout from here. I appreciated the parking lot - quick in and out. Staff greeted me right away and was helpful. Prompt service, many vegetarian options. The food was solid - I got sambal goreng tempeh which was really flavorful (some tempeh dishes can be bland) with a bit of heat. The most notable thing is that they take Bitcoin here!

I don't understand.  I just don't get it.  Why doesn't this place have a bajillion reviews? There's nothing else like it. Why is it that nobody knows what I'm talking about when I mention it?  Why is it always empty at lunch?  Maybe people are so overcome by the flavor profiles they aren't certain what to write?  Maybe I don't know enough adventurous eaters?  Maybe everyone goes there at dinner?   LUNCH IS WHERE IT'S AT YOU GUYS!   Dishes range from 8.50-11.00, pack quite a punch and offer up the perfect amount of food. This is probably the one place in town where I don't get the same thing time and time again, because the menu is so interesting... so diverse and it'll take you months to try everything.   I thought I had a favorite, you can read my earlier review, but the catfish today blew me away. Sweet, salty, spicy it had everything I look for but didn't leave me feeling over full. The crisp veggies and perfectly portioned rice round out the meal. And if catfish isn't your thing, eye over their other seafood options. They are plentiful, and servers are equipped with tons of knowledge about each dish.   Go. Eat. LOVE.  I look forward to the day I go at 12:30 and they say, "Sorry it's going to be about 25 minutes until we can seat you."

Want to keep your bandungkadonk in shape? Try the variety of fresh, healthy Indonesian and fusion dishes at Bandung.  I highly recommend the Ikan Rica Rica, a filet of mahi mahi served on steamed vegetables and covered with a delectable spicy sauce.    The service is a little slow, probably because everything is made from scratch, but the very flavorful food is worth the wait.  They have a good beer list with several exotic offerings such as Lion Stout from Sri Lanka.  The 10 percent off entire bill with Yelp check-in is a nice bonus.
Awesome food and good service. Takes awhile to get food but worth it. Squash and eggplant curry are 2 favorites. But, another outstanding dish was a catfish special they have on occasion.
Their pad Thai is the best in town (as advertised!!) and the environment is really cute. I go to this place like every month and absolutely love their pad Thai and thei egg roll!!
Good vibe, love the food, strangeish bar. Enjoyed pad Thai with chicken most recently.
Yesterday 11/28 ordered dinner from Bandung and item named Tempeh Goreng had all white fungus inside it, DISGUSTING!!

In the mood for comfort Indonesian food? It exists!  We ordered from Bandung about a year ago, and I know I loved my indo mac n cheese. We somehow never made it into the building itself until a Yelp Elite event. Yay!  Nice interior, and especially nice bar area. Big and open. The bartender was sassy and funny, and made us some great cocktails. Helloooo, Thai Iced Tea. We also nibbled on bites like cream cheese filled wontons and chicken wings (well, Derek did that one).  For our meals, Derek got chicken pad thai and I got the tofu fried rice. We ordered them off the small bites/happy hour menu. SO cheap! Derek's pad thai was much better than my fried rice. It was peanut-y and not too sweet. My fried rice was just a little too dry for my taste, but I liked the flavor overall. And each plate was piled high.  Thanks for a great treat! Can't wait to visit again and try something new.

I had Indonesian food in Amsterdam and love it.  We don't have any Indonesian restaurants in Minneapolis-St. Paul, so I was excited to find one in Madison, WI!  Upon review of the menu, I found about 6 or 7 different entrees that sounded great, and had a hard time choosing. So I asked the waitress about something I'd tried in Amsterdam: an arrangement of small plates with samples of many things on the menu.  And, great news - it's called "a rice table" and they had it (but it wasn't listed on the menu, so one has to have some insider information - or a proactive waitress). For $26/person,  you get to try many things and walk away a satisfied customer.

My husband and I really enjoyed our experience at  Bandung! It was pretty slow when we stopped there on a week night, but service was still a bit slow. We didn't let it get to us, though. The chicken pad thai and curry eggplant were both tasty!

I ordered ahead while I was waiting in a car wash line.  My order was ready for me when I arrived.  I was asked if I needed any utensils and I asked for a fork.  Minus a half point for the spork.  I would have asked for chopsticks had I known.  When I got home and unwrapped my items, everything smelled wonderful.  I got the Pad Thai with chicken.  It is a generous portion with a nice little kick.  Always use the lime wedge that is provided.  I also ordered the Beef Sate served with rice and Acar.  This was good but a bit different that I remembered.  The peanut sauce was thicker and bolder.  After I scraped some of it off, I really enjoyed the beef.  I might ask for the sauce to be added with a lighter hand or on the side next time I order that.  The Acar is always good.   This restaurant is a gem of Madison and I need to remember to stop in more often.

The best fried rice. The best pad thai. The best little cream cheese wonton things, the name of which I never remember. AND!? The best happy hour type special in town.   Seriously. You can get an appetizer, a heaping pile of pad thai, and a beer for about $12 if you eat in the Nutty Bar (the bar inside of Bandung).   Their "cheap eats" menu includes a bunch of favorites including thai fried rice, pad thai, indo mac & cheese, chicken wings, those cheese wonton things, and more. SUCH a good deal, and it is of the same quality as the restaurant menu.  Added bonus - the Nutty Bar has a nice low-key trivia night on Mondays, some of the best specialty drinks in towns, and some super friendly bartenders.  By far one of the best spots in town!

We had the opportunity to visit this restaurant for dinner last night while we were in Madison for a night. We got seated right away however it took forever for the server take our order. We finally had to ask them to take our order.  The restaurant had vegetarian options which was really good for us. We ordered a cold salad as appetizer and a mango curry with jasmine rice. The food was phenomenal. I guess I can say the wait was worth it but not when you are starving.   I am not sure if I would visit this particular restaurant again as there are a lot of other cuisines and options for meals in this university town.
The flavors are awesome. This is coming from a person who makes Indian food, so i know flavors and spices a lot. I am coming here next time too. I had catfish (Kari Lele) and it was tooo good.

I went to Bandung with a friend today and it was relatively quiet. We ordered 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and Thai teas, for under $65. We came away very satisfied, everything was unique and full of flavor.   Details on each dish below:    Drinks: I'd highly recommend getting the Thai tea. Its a sweet, refreshing drink not unlike Vietnamese Iced coffee.   Appetizers: We ordered the pangsit keju and Martaban tetor to start. Both were fantastic but portions were pretty small. The pangist keju were little deep fried cream cheese balls. Similar to crab rangoons, but the filling was much tastier and had a good spice. Martban tetor were little pastries filled with ground beef and rice noodles. I'd describe them as a great 'egg roll' alternative.   Entrees: For entrees were ordered Daging Rendang and "the best pad Thai in town". The Daging Rendang contained savory beef and potato pieces that contained complex flavors and spice. Highly recommend it. The pad thai was perfectly spiced and had all of the classic elements you'd expect. I've tried quite a few pad thai's and I'd say this is definitely one of the top takes on the dish.

This is the second time I have ordered delivery from Bandung and I am beyond impressed! Not only with the quality and flavor of the food, but by the delivery speed and complete order accuracy. Can't say enough good things about this restaurant! Would give more stars if I could!

Overall, it was a nice ambiance but I found the food underwhelming. The tempeh chips were yummy, but they needed some sauce to go with them. My husband and I had Sayur Lodeh which was yummy. The rice was served too far before the entrees and was cold by the time the entrees arrived. We were in a large group, but there is no excuse for cold rice. The Mango Curry and Holy Basil had too many bamboo shoots and not enough tempeh. Also the tempeh was very bland.  Additionally, the Holy Basil dish tasted like licorice (which I don't like) and did not say it on the menu which is odd. The best part of the meal was the dessert, Mango Sorbet. Not enough for us to return however.

I always order for delivery from here. For the last (almost) 2 years, I've been living abroad and ordering Pad Thai remotely on Thursdays for the Pad Thai Palooza. When I still lived in Madison, I would order it for my father, Co Workers, and myself, now I'm just ordering for my father for this tradition that will never stop. The wait staff and people answering the phones (well done, Matt Long!) make it so easy. I'm excited to actually go in and have the Pad Thai there in person as I remember it as Pad Thai don't here in Israel is not as authentic.

Hands down our favorite restaurant in Madison.  Another fun ethnic food option in town.    Favorites here include the Oseng Oseng Tempe (they make their own tempe on site), and the Holy Basil with chicken.  Meals are flavorful with several options depending on your tastes.  Also they often times have discounts available through Groupon or the local Bucky Book so look around if you plan to stop.

The Pengsit Goreng were really tiny and couldn't taste anything but ginger and pepper in the Curry fried rice. Food here is expensive and the 2 stars are for also for the quick service and friendly staff.

I have been here twice and each time the food was underwhelming. Not bad, by any stretch, but quite bland. I am not sure if that is specific to the genre (I have never tried Indonesian food before) or if it speaks more to a restaurants attempts to cater to the midwestern palate. Be that as it may, I would never proactively choose to go here; that being said, I also wouldn't reject it if suggested by a friend.

Ok, I preface this with the fact that there was a LARGE indonesian community back home where I lived, and there was probably a significant portion of my life where I existed on Nasigoreng and lumpias.... Was this healthy, hell no.  But I was 14 and had the metabolism of, well.... a 14 year old... Sigh.. those were the days..  So everytime I go to Bandung, I am a *tiny* bit saddened that they don't "do it like they did back home" (he he he... that sounds.. ahem!).  Which is why I've started having cocktails before.  Their Long Island Iced Thai Tea is a dream.  It's EXACTLY what a LIIT should be, a poor excuse for trying to get as much alcohol as possible in one container.  Add the creamy goodness of a Thai tea, and WOW... you've got a sweet and exotic drink that will satisfy the masses.  The lumpias are so crisp and delicious.    The nasigoreng...well... I've had better, but they do make a good job at it, I WILL say.  I think it's got to be something with the tofu.  I *thought* they don't season the tofu, and thus when you eat the nasigoreng, the rice and veggies are really good, but maybe if you leave the rice for the next day, the taste will seep in the tofu.  Well.. Thanks to their GENEROUSLY sized portions, this is exactly what I did.  I tasted the nasi the next day... PERFECTION.  Too bad I can't exactly recommend to them to give me last night's nasigoreng.... hehe.  Fried banana dessert (hey, I'm ALL about desserts), is a dream.....

A disappointment. I used to LOVE Bandung, but it has certainly gone downhill.   First off, we were a group of six and initially we had a very charismatic and attentive server, but midway through, they switched us over to someone whose service was a bit slower, but not entirely bad. So, overall, service was probably the best aspect of the meal.   The meal itself was bland, flavorless, and unfulfilling. The curries were soupy and lacking meat. We had the following for appetizers: martabak telor, tahu goreng, pansit goreng, rujak cuka. The tofu was tough and flavorless in the tahu goring, the rujak cuka was $5.95 for garnish, the pansit goreng was a tasty little fried, stuffed wonton but wasn't particularly inspired, and the martabak telor was flavorful but much too greasy.   As for the dinner entrees we split the following: daging rendang, gulai kambing, kari lele, and red curry squash with tofu. Squash curry is my all-time favorite food but it was reduced to an insipid coconut-flavored puddle with a few pieces of squash, eggplant, and tofu when we went to Bandung. For fabulous squash curry, avoid Bandung at all costs and head to Lao Laan Xang or Sa-Bai Thong. Unfortunately the curse of watery curry also afflicted the gulai kambing. The other dishes did not leave lasting impressions, with the exception of the kari lele, which was spiced nicely, but woefully overdone.   ***All of these things didn't make the experience of dining at Bandung one-star-review-worthy. However, the party in the next room did. The restaurant hosted a "private" party in its adjacent room (note: only a wall separates both rooms and there are open doors). The party was not private in that we heard everything happening, including the most atrocious karaoke singing heard by sober ears for approximately 30 minutes (someone even attempted to sing "Bohemian Rhapsody"). This was not a good environment for a friend whose parents had just come in to sit down for a leisurely meal with him and his friends.***  Not cool.

Wow! This is a solid 4 stars authentic Indonesian Restaurant in the middle of Madison Wisconsin. Geographically and Climatically about as far away as you can get from Indonesia, I am surprised at just how good and authentic this place is.  I was so excited about this find, that I ordered about 3 times more food than I needed.  The peanut sauce rice cakes, the satay, and the squash curry were my favorites. The dark peanut sauce is deliciously addictive.

Excellent food.  Great staff; both very friendly and very patient.  Lots of vegan options (and nonveg as well).  If you ask for spicy, it will be spicy.  I love the heat.  Plus the homemade tempe is delicious too.  I wish it were closer to me in Chicago.  Right now it's the closest Indo food to me.

The food was always good there. The only reason I did not give it five was the seating, it was too small a table and people have to sit really close. I am not a big fan of being close in person and the table also made it hard to order a lot of things at the same time.

It had been a long time since I'd been to Bandung, and I remembered it being delicious so my husband and I stopped last time we were in Madison.  The service was great, the drinks were good, but the food was all very bland.  There's so many good restaurants in Madison, we definitely won't be returning to Bandung again.

I recently moved downtown and now Bandung is a 2 minute walk from me, which sounds dangerous.  Surprisingly, I've only ever gotten takeout from here - even before I moved downtown. Their takeout service is quick and they have you sit at the bar where they give you water and make sure you're taken care of.  I ordered the Eggplant Curry to-go. I loved it. They gave a really good portion. I couldn't finish it. The curry wasn't too spicy either, which is perfect for me.  In the past, I've gotten items with tempeh. They cook tempeh really well! Their vegetarian dishes are really good, so definitely bring your vegan/vegetarian friends here!

I've dined at Bandung of my own accord and with a Yelp event, and both trips were unique in the dishes and flavors I was able to try.  My first experience here was on a chilly day and I ordered the perfect entree to warm up. I settled on the Pad Rum Mit, which was chicken stir fried with broccoli, fresh mushroom, napa, baby corn and pea pods in a light spicy garlic sauce. White rice was served alongside the hearty plate and made for a great deal of food.  The next time at Bandung was with Yelp and we sampled the pangsit keju (cream cheese wontons) as a group. I then ordered the Gado Gado as my entree, which was a steamed green bean, carrot, cabbage, broccoli, bean sprouts, egg and tempeh topped with mild peanut sauce. The peanut sauce made the plate. Without it, I would not be loving this dish so much as the combination of cooked and raw veggies, along with the ever interestingly textured tempeh, was weird. When topped with peanut sauce though, I could pretty much polish the plate.    I will certainly be back to try more of their dishes once the weather cools down and curries begin calling my name.

We wanted something different but still Asian or Asian-ish and Indonesian fit the bill. So we came across this cozy restaurant with bar attached in a quasi-industrial strip mall next to a bike shop off the corner of downtown.   They make their tempeh in house and in my opinion it was the highlight of the dinner. We tried tempeh in the Sayur Lodeh (veggie coconut soup) as well as a complimentary side of Tempeh Chips. The soup was a bit bland but the Tempeh Chips were better. Texture was good. Tasted more fresh than tofu. The other appetizer we got was the Otak Otak, fish cake in banana leaves. I've had a couple fish-type-things in banana leaves, but never fish cake. It was really good and came with a spicy sauce.   For the main dishes, we got the Bebek Bekar (roast duck) and daily special which was yellow curry over mung bean noodles with Tempeh. The curry was good from start to finish. The duck came with a sliced breast and a couple pieces of leg. The spices were phenomenal and the texture was spot on. But the sauce it came with was just a little too sweet. It reminded me of Chinese Peking duck (it may be based on that) but a bit sweeter.   Prices are fair and you get 10% off with Yelp check-in. Service was very friendly.
no offense but the waiter or the server should really need to learn that the rice and the curry should be placed into two different boxes to go!

Long Island Thai Tea is the best drink ever. The house made tempeh is incredible. I ordered a small portion but I should have gotten the regular size. All four of us loved our food. Try going during happy hour at their nutty bar for really good deals on food and drinks.

I am giving this 3 stars because we all thought the food was delicious. The wait staff was horrendous! We did not have a reservation and were told there was a 20-30 minute wait, so we decided to wait. The waiting area has some tables and what appears to be a bar. We were handed a drink menu and when we decided and tried to order we were told they could not get us a drink as they were all too busy waiting on and bussing tables! In our 30 minute wait, we never got a drink. We waited forever for the one glass of water we had for the evening. Our water glasses were never refilled, we were never asked if we wanted a second cocktail. Every time a server came to our table (there were a total of 4 throughout the night) they apologized for the wait, the slow service etc., but it never got any better, The place was full, but I do not think that was the reason for the poor service. This has to be the worst run place we have ever dined at. One person in our party ordered a martini with an olive. When it arrived, no olive, but a promise of one soon. It was at least 10 minutes until the olive showed up. Our food was tasty, but small portions and pricey. We had a gift certificate, but failed to let them know ahead of time. I am pretty sure they tack on 18% for having the gift certificate!!! We noticed the sign on the way out to tell them prior to ordering that you have one. I wonder if our service would have been even worse then??? All in all we were there over 2 hours and had the worst service of our lives! I can't imagine not wanting to improve it. Judging by the other reviews here we were not the only ones to experience this

Went in for dinner today and thoroughly enjoyed the food there. I ordered a nasi goreng, aka Indonesian fried rice, and thought it was superb. It was dry and very flavorful. I will definitely come back the next time I am in Madison.

I love Bandung!   I've been in a handful of times now, and every visit has been a wonderful experience.   The cocktails at the Nutty Bar are fun and creative. The Thai Long Island Iced Tea is truly an amazing creation. Be careful, they go down easy!   As far as food goes - omg. You will not be disappointed. We always start with the satay skewers. You can get it in chicken, tofu, lamb or beef, but I prefer the beef. Tender, succulent morsels of steak served in a creamy, flavorful peanut sauce. The peanut sauce, for real, you could put on anything and make it wonderful.  I've tried a few of the noodle dishes now and I don't have a favorite. They have all been really great. Flavorful, well spiced, good texture.. you can't go wrong.   Service especially has always been on point. PJ has been the bartender a few times when I have been there, and most recently he was our server. Super attentive and offers great suggestions.   Overall - 12/10 recommend!
Good food. A great selection of dishes. The atmosphere is very relaxed but several dishes are on the pricier side.

My third time here, this time for drinks and dinner before a show. Pretty awesome place! The guy in the kitchen knows his stuff, the staff is super nice and friendly, they have a great happy hour and bar menu and you gotta get the mega-satay (beef). It's certainly my new place for Phad Thai. Yum!!
